name: dinette
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
mainly US a small room or part of a room used for eating meals in: The boat's three cabins sleep six and the saloon features a dinette and crescent-shaped sofa. The first floor includes a child's bedroom, the living room, the kitchen and a dinette.
US a table for eating meals on, together with a set of chairs that usually match the table: The showroom has an array of plush upholstered furniture and solid-wood dinettes. He has always sold dishwashers and dinette sets.
More examplesFewer examplesThe apartment was so tiny that two of the children had to sleep in the dinette.Cans of food are stored under the dinette benches.This one-bedroom complex has a large bright sitting area with couch and dinette table and chairs.People used to throw old couches and dinettes in the ditch.Credit cards make it easier than ever for shoppers to get a car loan, finance a dinette set or buy movie tickets.
